intro: Tassadia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered tassadia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Tassadia minutiflora is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to local wildlife.
